title: Shell to stop exploration activity in Alaska
content:
12:47 a.m. CDT 
 
(Reuters) - Royal Dutch Shell Plc said it would stop exploration activity in offshore Alaska after poor results from a key well in the Chukchi Sea. 
 
The company said it did not find sufficient amounts of oil and gas in the Burger J well, located about 150 miles from Barrow, Alaska, to warrant further exploration in the Burger prospect. 
 
Shell said it expected to take a financial charge from the development. 
 
(Reporting by Abhiram Nandakumar in Bengaluru; Editing by Anupama Dwivedi)
